perturbation.original_text: Each shipment of Product shall be accompanied by a certificate of analysis describing all current requirements of the Specifications and results of tests performed on such Product and a certificate of conformity certifying that the quantities of Product supplied have been Manufactured, controlled and released according to the Required Standards ("COA/COC") as set forth in the applicable Quality Agreement (subject to SutroVax's conduct of the SutroVax Activity Test to confirm Extract meets the SutroVax Activity Criteria). The COA/COC acceptance criteria for each Product shall be set forth in the Specification for such Product.
perturbation.changed_text: Each shipment of Product may be accompanied by a document. The acceptance criteria for each Product shall be determined by the supplier.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for a Certificate of Analysis (COA) and Certificate of Conformity (COC) eliminates a key consumer protection. COAs and COCs are standard in pharmaceutical and biologics supply agreements to ensure quality and compliance. By removing this, the contract violates laws that mandate quality control and documentation for pharmaceutical products, potentially endangering consumer safety.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; 21 C.F.R. Sections 210 and 211 (cGMPs)

perturbation.original_text: Sutro shall obtain and maintain any and all regulatory and governmental permits, licenses and approvals that are necessary for Sutro to Manufacture the Product(s) for SutroVax or its Affiliates in accordance with the terms of this Supply Agreement and Applicable Law. As between the Parties, SutroVax shall have the sole responsibility for all Regulatory Approvals of the Vaccine Compositions.
perturbation.changed_text: Sutro may obtain regulatory and governmental permits and licenses as it deems necessary. SutroVax shall have the responsibility for regulatory considerations.
perturbation.explanation: This weakens Sutro's obligation to maintain necessary permits and licenses, creating a legal contradiction. Applicable law mandates specific permits and approvals for manufacturing pharmaceuticals; making this discretionary puts SutroVax at risk of receiving non-compliant products.

perturbation.original_text:
Sutro represents and warrants that:

7.3.1 Sutro's Facility and all Product (as delivered in accordance with Section 2.1 and until the expiration date thereof) supplied hereunder (and the Manufacture thereof) shall comply with this Supply Agreement, all Applicable Law (including cGMPs, if applicable),Â·be free from defects in material and workmanship, and meet all Specifications.
perturbation.changed_text:
Sutro represents and warrants that:

7.3.1 Sutro's Facility and all Product supplied hereunder shall meet the company standards.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the warranty that the facility and product comply with Applicable Law (including cGMPs) creates a significant legal risk. cGMPs are legally required standards for pharmaceutical manufacturing. This omission weakens Sutro's accountability and violates legal requirements for product quality and safety.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act; 21 C.F.R. Sections 210 and 211 (cGMPs)
